newsitem.title: ITALY: SOCCER-PERUZZI HELPS JUVENTUS TOWARDS TITLE.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-PERUZZI HELPS JUVENTUS TOWARDS TITLE.

text.p: Italy goalkeeper Angelo Peruzzi made a dramatic last minute save to earn 10-man Juventus a 0-0 draw at Napoli and help them take another step towards their 24th league title on Sunday.

With Parma losing 1-0 at Fiorentina -- their first defeat since January -- Peruzzi's clean-sheet was enough to give Juve a commanding six-point lead at the top of serie A with just nine games to play.

With virtually the last kick of the match, Napoli's Alfredo Aglietti forced Peruzzi into a reflex save after Juventus had kept the home side at bay throughout the second half without their Uruguayan defender Paolo Montero.
Montero was sent off in the 37th minute for denying Nicola Caccia a clear run at goal.
With Alen Boksic and Vladimir Jugovic suspended and Alessandro Del Piero injured, Juve were already up against it.
But the 10 men on show responded with a battling performance that underlines why they have the best defensive record in the league --- 15 goals in 25 matches.
Parma's defeat came via the boot of their French international Lilian Thuram, whose outstanding performances have solidified the Parma defence.
In the 33rd minute, Thuram's outstretched foot deflected a shot from Portugal's Rui Costa beyond the despairing dive of Gian Luigi Buffon and into the net.
Parma's defeat boosted third-placed Internazionale's hopes of qualifying for next season's European Cup as runners-up.
Roy Hodgson's team now trail Parma by just two points following their 2-1 home win over Verona.
Maurizio Ganz, whose goals saw off Anderlecht in the UEFA Cup in midweek, found target again in the 31st minute only to see Filippo Maniero equalise within two minutes.
But 13 minutes into the second-half, Ganz's overhead kick set up Marco Branca for his side's winner.
Sampdoria are a further point adrift in fourth after fighting back from 2-0 down to draw 2-2 at Piacenza with goals from Vincenzo Montella -- his 17th this season -- and Emanuele Pesaresi.
Dutchman Michel Kreek scored twice as Perugia recovered from 2-1 down to win their relegation clash with Cagliari 3-2.
Champions AC Milan continued to climb, reaching seventh place after a 2-0 victory at Atalanta, only their second win since manager Arrigo Sacchi took charge back in December.
Liberian George Weah silenced the home crowd by heading the opener in the 10th minute from a Marco Simone cross and Stefano Eranio made sure of the victory in the 67th minute.
Eranio had spent the first half on the bench despite his selection on Saturday in Cesare Maldini's Italy squad.
Lazio's 2-0 victory at Vicenza was marred by a pitch invasion sparked by the dismissal of the home side's defender Giovanni Lopez in the 80th minute. The match was suspended for seven minutes.
